titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 18-19 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 18-19
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the October 18 and 19, 1825 sessions of court, in which several cases were heard, mostly in regard to property compensation. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: Tuesday 18th
div1.p: Court convened agreeable to adjournment Present Their Honors John Martin &C Geo. Saunders, Fore

Thomas Petit Ptf
vs
John Downing Dft
A plea for settlement
Non suited with costs of suit, G. Saunders Foreman
suit Whirl Wind for six days attending at 50 Cents per day as witnessed $3_00

Mary Taylor Cpt
vs
Fox Taylor Dft
a plea of debt
It is the opinion of the Court that Mary Taylor Shall have half the price the negroe was sold for, say $200_00

George W. Snoot Ptf
vs
Josep Phillips Dft
a plea for a horse
It is the opinion of the Court that the plaintiff shall recover, his horse, saddle & bridle that the defendant bought of W. Wilkerson

Thomas Chissom & R RatliffCpts
vs
Mrs Path Killer & heirs Dfts
a plea for negroes
Court is adjourned untill tomorrow 10 Oclock

div1.head: Wednesday 19th
div1.p: Court convened agreeable to adjournment Present their Honors John Martin &C Geo. Saunders

Sally Hughes Ptf
vs
Richard Roe Dft
a plea for negroes
Continued

Nelson & John Riley Ptf
vs
Samuel Gunter & D. Brown Exrs. of R. Riley Decd. Dfts
Continued
Continued

The Judges of the Supreme Court have decreed that they have no congnisance of the above case from circumstances & evidences introduced in the above case, it did not come under the limitation act.by Path killer & Heirs
